narrative.narrative: Elbee Airlines was a cargo airline from June 1995 to July 1998 and was based at Mumbai (Bombay),India. It started with threee Fokker F27's and operated routes to Delhi,Balgalore and Chennai. It lost one of its planes in a crash in 1997. It was part of Elbee Services, one of India's largest express logistics companies that would also go on to close down in 2002. However in 2004 a new company was founded and the name brought back. Elbee Airlines also flew for UPS. It had plans to spend 57 million dollars on three Boeing 727's and three DC-10's but the 1997 crash hindered business and it would go on to close in July 1998.
